title: Wes Anderson
summary: Wesley Wales Anderson (born May 1, 1969) is an American filmmaker. His films are known for their eccentricity and distinctive visual and narrative styles.[1] Cited by some critics as a modern-day example of the work of an auteur, three of Anderson's films – The Royal Tenenbaums, Moonrise Kingdom, and The Grand Budapest Hotel – appeared in BBC Culture's 2016 poll of the greatest films since 2000.[2]
